# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Output: my_column
```
This function works by first stripping leading and trailing whitespaces from the string using `strip`, then converting all characters to lower case. It replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores using a regular expression (`r"[\s-]" => "_")`.
